thread.title: Santos pushes ahead with plans for huge CSG project in NSW
thread.title_full: Santos pushes ahead with plans for huge CSG project in NSW

title: Santos pushes ahead with plans for huge CSG project in NSW
text: | MP3 download As debate continues to roil about how to secure the nation's energy grid, a major resources company is pushing ahead with plans to develop controversial coal seam gas mining in the north-west of New South Wales.Santos is seeking approval to drill more than 800 CSG wells around the Pilliga state forest near Narrabri.Earlier this month, it submitted its environmental impact statement, with the proposal now open for public comment.Farmers fear it could have a disastrous impact on the region, but others see CSG as playing a vital role in the nation's energy supplies.Featured: Malcolm Roberts, chief executive, Australian Petroleum Production and Exploration AssociationJeremy Buckingham, Greens MP
